availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Boyd (McCracken County, KY, farmer and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Abe Boyd and Nannie Sim Boyd.Father of Agnes J. Boyd, Adaline Boyd, Martha A. Boyd, and Lucy C. Boyd. Married to Elizabeth F. Boyd. Farmer in Trigg County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Farmer in McCracken County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in McCracken County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.
